title: Captain John Smith Chesapeake National Historic Trail: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park       Looking for more information?     News Browse press releases, articles and like our Facebook page to stay up-to-date on trail and Bay news.   James River Transmission Line Project Visitors to the trail near Historic Jamestowne could lose the historic and scenic views that help them imagine the time of English settlement here. On this page, you'll find a brief statement of a proposed transmission line project, a short background, and links to documents that provide explanation and analysis.   Photos & Multimedia View and share pictures and media of adventures along the trail!   History & Culture Discover the people, personalities and cultures who have influenced and make up the rich heritage of the Trail and the Chesapeake Bay.   Science & Research  Read about the Bay Buoys that mark the trail as well as Captain John Smith's maps and the history of early explorer's bay "research".    Education Tools and resources for educators to explore the trail and engage students.   Kids & Youth Learn about the history of the Chesapeake Bay and become a Junior Ranger for the Captain John Smith Chesapeake Trail.   Management Find our office, operating hours, the comprehensive plan and contact information.
